intro: Clavija parvula, commonly known as the small clavija, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and finely divided leaves. It typically grows in moist, shady environments such as forest undergrowth. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and less-studied species in botanical research.
